intro: Appendicula vanimoensis, commonly known as the Vanimo appendicula, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae, which includes many ornamental and horticulturally significant species. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically orange or red in color, with distinctive spurred petals. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found growing in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
